Photo of McKoy's Smokehouse & Saloon - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of McKoy's Smokehouse & Saloon - Charlotte, NC, United States

L35Mi3jtWXJH6a8-sGIUzA.text: Best grilled wings and blue cheese. Get them double grilled. Ribs and Mac and cheese excellent too. Going back before we leave Charlotte on Sunday. Here for the ACC game. Go Noles!

xinFBcOPeJNoV8sjxKFtgQ.text: Great BBQ and great service.  Just the atmosphere I expect from an authentic BBQ joint.  Not fancy but good food at a good price!  Half price appetizers were a nice surprise.

_nncSn5TccWlYpf8Q2_Fkw.text: Good service.  Great rich food. What else should I ask for. I ordered pulled smoke pork was great. It cone with two sides I got green beans and saute mushrooms, the sides where done gray from fresh veggies. Will go again.

E9iH1QlFJndY5LSi-2LaZg.text: Was not a fan of the pork plate. Pork was dry and not ver flavorful.  Ambience was upbeat.  Bar was hopping.  Bbq in the south should be better than this.

lg-3Yg3UuUsIMuvxNMvkTA.text: Oh my god! The staff? The atmosphere, the people, the food! All great! Portions so big I always leave with a to go box!

3rkYevFI3I3fYC7hTs_bGQ.text: Been coming here for a few years, but food quality and service has gotten much worse recently.  Barbecue was greasy and ribs were fatty and full of gristle. Said something to our server and she didn't really seem to care. I made sure that was reflected in her tip.  It's her job to let management know about issues coming from the kitchen. I could understand if they were very busy, but the place was half full and the patio was empty. Won't be coming back anytime soon or spending my money here. Very disappointing!

aEVSn_2JAs-LePpDiTG2qg.text: So I got the smokes chicken wings and Mac N Cheese. They were both really good!!!  And the service there was great. The bill also wasn't that much for what I received food and drink wise, so that was awesome!  All in all, it was a really good experience, and I definitely recommend the place!

qoP5zyiinECUcrahCEEeCQ.text: Oh my goodness !! Good- fantastic service- awesome  atmosphere- soft and friendly. I'll be back next week. That cheese corn bread hmmmm.

gwY-I-UPuqKfpB9fn-pNRQ.text: Ba Ba Ba BarBeQue is all I can say... Being a NON PORK eater from the North it's no wonder why we never been here. Our daughter Godparents who are very fond of the pig, came down for a visit and really wanted BBQ. We've lived here for about 4 years now and had never been out for BBQ so I looked to Yelp & Low and Behold this place popped up with reviews from some of my fellow Elite who I trust.  It was a rainy day when we checked this place out and as we ran to the door to enter people who were exiting looked Happy and FULL & begin to tell us "Best Choice Ever". Our guest were excited and asked a couple questions to the patrons. We were say in the back corner booth for our party of 6.   My husband and I ordered the seafood fried with the squash. The squash was not as good as I read it to be, it had flavor with a lot of oil. The seafood was Meh ( I guess that's why it's a BBQ house not a seafood house ). Our guest on the other hand had Ba Ba Ba BarBeQue and they LOVED IT.  I wouldn't go back UNLESS we have guest that want pork BBQ.

izo7_5hmMA1oRoQvj6hzbQ.text: I had heard about this place for awhile. I think I just found my new favorite place. Everything was so delicious! Definitely order a basket of dinner rolls or cornbread and make sure you get the fried squash! The place was packed full but the owner greeted everyone going in and out. He also came by our table and brought us samples to try for our next visit. From the outside this may look like a bike bar but on the inside is a fantastic atmosphere, great service, and gourmet food!

qX306G9ohuyXvDh3VLr2Bw.text: Not too thrilled with the menu or happy hour specials.   Nothing really stood out on the menu. I was here with the intention on trying the wings and they were just okay. Not bad or anything but not memorable either. I've had better roasted wings in Charlotte. I tried my friend's fried chicken platter as well and it was decent.   The hour hour specials were pretty blah. There's domestic beer specials and maybe a house or well cocktail / liquor type. It's more of a divey spot so you shouldn't expect a wealth of craft beer options and or fancy schmancy cocktails.   I might give McKoy's another try, but wouldn't suggest this place as a go-to for wings.

EgnDETffVGYoUNIocwivSA.text: Give them the pickle - not at McKoys.  Food was average at best. Staff was friendly but not empowered to make decisions.

mg7OGyMs4GXAVt_lhJGzWg.text: As a black man in 2019 I don't see how any black person can sit in this place where on  four TVs they have Fox News on. I mean come my people. They should put a sign out front that says trump 2020 wake up my people.. BEWARE OF WHO YOUR SUPPORTING

9rAe9kJfgcSjYoN0eR3Ucg.text: This place serves the best pot roast you can buy in Charlotte. I put off trying this place because they don't serve brisket and while I like pulled pork I don't have the same love affair with it to begin with as I do with some nice juicy beef. Based on the reviews from other Yelpers I decided to go one evening after work to try this famous pot roast and I am now hooked.  We were enthusiastically greeted upon entering and led straight to a table. I ordered a $4 mango mojito which was promptly served and it was as sweet as it was refreshing. Since we were basically starving upon arrival we ordered the appetizer sampler. In hindsight this was too ambitious for just the two of us since we were ordering full diners as well. The nachos and potato skins were delicious and the establishment did not skimp on the cheese. I loved the chicken fingers which were juicy on the inside and crispy on the outside. I am not huge on bone in wings but my dining companion said they were excellent.   I ordered a soup as one of my fixin's, and it came out before the entrees as requested. It was potato and bacon and super creamy and filling. This could have easily served as an appetizer to hold me over until dinner.  When the mains came (we both opted for pot roast) I saw the soup again and when the waitress saw she remembered that I already had the soup brought out but shrugged and said that I get two soups today. This was totally okay with me - free food is one of my favorite things. The pot roast was completely tender. There was some fat to pick around but the generous portion made me feel like I wasn't being skimped on. They must cook this roast for hours to get the beef so tender. The darker sauce (not sure what it was called, not vinegar based) that was at our table was a great compliment to the pot roast.   Overall both the food and service were great and I will definitely be back! PS - the leftover pot roast made for great sandwiches the next day.

photos.caption: Photo of McKoy's Smokehouse & Saloon - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sampler platter

uB5kjU1sJqRcGOpYrqr0QA.text: If you HATE delicious Mac and cheese, battered fried squash, tender and juicy pulled pork and great service--this isn't the place for you. Our first experience here...but certainly not our last. Way to go, Ryan Register!  You're definitely doing something right here at McKoy's!

AH3nuF0w8z0EqkTnNPG6YA.text: Besides the wonderful food and great staff,especially if you are into INK. i am going to make this place to be one of my regular hangouts.  Not too bad on the Wallet as well. Please try the Spicy wings and the Mac and Cheese, one of the best in Charlotte. Food does not disappoint. Excellent Americana..

CKtH4kMY2mENRpGeBujfRg.text: Thursday's .50 cent wing night! Woohoo! That's what brought me to this place.  Started off with the queso and homemade chips. Yum yum! The homemade chips were fresh and the queso was light. I didn't notice a lot of chicken  but a few shreds every few bites. The wings are huge and covered in sauce. Now my bf wanted ours double grilled....well that wasn't for me. They come exactly as it's worded on the menu "crispy and charred". No sauce (sweet BBQ) and nicely charred. My friend's regular ones had my mouth watering...next time next time. I just had to try the mac and cheese, of course. Oh dear gosh cheese! It was amazing! Get it!  I sat outside with a party of 8 to watch a Thursday night football game. Which was perfect because they have two tv's and put on the sound. The service was good too. I'll be back for some green beans (heard they are great) and some regular bar-Balo wings!

photos.caption: Photo of McKoy's Smokehouse & Saloon - Charlotte, NC, United States. 10 double charred sweet BBQ wings
Photo of McKoy's Smokehouse & Saloon - Charlotte, NC, United States. Queso and homemade chips

P6YNgmOpPH4QGbDOc7hZZw.text: The Best Arnold Palmer I've had since we moved to South Carolina. It's so fresh- I had the pulled chicken sandwich sandwich and it was amazing! The meat is smoked and just when it hits you know they aren't lying. The cornbread was slightly different than what I'm used too. It was cheesy and really good as well! A hit with my kiddos. We knew we made a good choice when you can smell the food from the parking lot

2lTZLnHR_21U4yHMtfSImg.text: It is most definately a good thing when you arrive at the restaurant and have to park across the road. I was expecting good, and had greatness.   Cassy, my waitress pointed me towards the ribs, and I was not dissapointed. They have both tomato based and Vinegar based sauce, and both were excellent. However, you don't need them, as the smoke ring went all the way to the bone, which the ribs fell right off.   Finally, I had saved room for desert, and the family recipe coconut pie was excellent. Save room for this to top off you dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of McKoy's Smokehouse & Saloon - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fall off the bone ribs. Excellent.

vowJuC-4d63HUKmfLRT6AA.text: This place is hidden behind a gas station, and it's worth finding. Delicious barbecue and plenty of variety if you would like something else.   The chicken and pulled pork are great, potato salad is creamy and tangy, the baked potato is packed with lots of meat (your choice). Great service, cozy but comfy.

5YfcqC2NNZC7gDryxVLrQA.text: I celebrated my birthday here and went during dinner. Surprisingly it wasn't crowded for a Saturday night. It definitely has a country, saloon feel with a laid back atmosphere. I ordered wings and macaroni and cheese. The wings were so delicious and are the best wings I've ever tasted and I'm a wing fanatic. The wings were grilled and had the perfect amount of char on them and they were full of flavor. The macaroni and cheese was delicious, creamy, and well seasoned. The waitress was friendly as well. I enjoyed my dinner and will be back when I return to Charlotte!

PhdtqTuGgPdK7skGv17N3w.text: I'll have to say that the award for this score, hands down belongs to John Ashley, the manager of this place. Rude, condescending, impatient, unprofessional, and quiet frankly, as arrogant as they come. The man clearly has no business being in front of the house, he should be exclusively in the back of the house.   Why? He literally exhibits the worst aspects of customer service. First, if a customer is complaining politely to you, don't raise your voice. Show some empathy, listen to the concern of your customer, show them respect, calm the situation and most importantly, just learn how to take some light constructive criticism, take ownership of the mistake and after apologize. Trust me, us telling you that the oil needs to be change in your fryer, doesn't mean it is an attack for him to get defensive. It simply means the chicken did not look golden at all, and we were served burnt chicken cooked in burnt oil, and it needs to be properly cleaned and disposed of. It's simply stating a fact, because you could both see it and smell it. This is an opportunity to simply fix a problem.   However, this is what you don't do, as to how John Ashley handled the situation.   Do not get defensive or Falsely accuse someone of "cursing at you", which by the way, it never happened.  Don't get loud with the customer. Don't shout over the customer. Never talk over a customer, and especially when they are trying to answer your questions, while you are interrupting with False assumptions. Definitely you should not ever say "I don't know what else you want me to do" after 2 minutes of a conversation with a customer. Definitely don't huff or puff and be dismissive of someone's complaint. And lastly, don't hang up on a customer not once, but twice because you don't like to hear a simple concern. If you're incapable in following these simple procedures, because you cannot put your pride aside, you shouldn't be a manager, and just stick to running the back of the house. Also, if a customer is trying to show some respect to you, how about you reach out and shake their hand, instead of walking out angrily because once again, you sir can't control your emotions. Clearly the owners need someone who knows efficiently how to run the front of the house. Clearly the owners need to spend some money for this employee to take some customer service classes or actually find a professional that knows how to properly deal with the customer, instead of looking for an argument.   The only positives? The server and staff were helpful. Some of my other dishes, like the Country Style Steak, which looked mostly like a Salisbury Steak, it had a nice sauce, but it was slapped with a few hamburger patties. Also, the Mac and cheese was cheesy, gooey and simply on point. I could eat it everyday! However, that won't ever happen with this experience. I can't recommend this place at all.

MJV3l7dwYTtYdW4dfiYPuw.text: Good and smokey pulled pork. If you get the coleslaw on top, just know the bun won't stand up to it. Really good smoked wings, and the ribs have been tried and approved on other visits with colleagues. Vinegar BBQ sauce seemed more vinegar than anything else. Tomato based sauce is flavorful with a more normal consistency. Non-threatening biker bar atmosphere.

U4eY3oLm6gDdo9qpVkB3Aw.text: After furiously yelping "BBQ in Charlotte", we stopped here on our way down to Hilton Head.  We thoroughly enjoyed our experience here.  Food was awesome, price was reasonable and worth what you get.  Atmosphere: Was more local bar than BBQ restaurant, which I loved.  Casual, unassuming, chill.   Service: Great!  One of the owners recognized that it was our first time and brought us a sampler platter before we made our choices.  They were obviously very busy, but the service was fast, attentive and just what we needed.   Food: Started with the grilled wings, which were awesome.  Fall off the bone tender, would 100% recommend them again.    We wanted to try everything so ordered the Living the Dream platter, comes with chicken, ribs, pulled pork and pot roast.  Chicken and ribs were solid, honestly the chicken in the wing appetizer was way better.  The stars were really the pulled pork and pot roast.  I LOVE pulled pork and this was the best I have ever had.  Flavor without any sauce was juicy and tasty and the sauce options just elevated it.  I've never had bbq pot roast before, but this stuff is bomb.  We couldn't stop eating it.  For sides we got sweet potato fries and mac n cheese, most were great additions.  I mentioned before that the owner gave us a small sampler where we also got to try the greens which were also really good.  The portion for the price is fantastic and totally worth it.  We split the LTD between the two of us and had enough for 2 more dinners left over.   Overall: I want to drive back to the Carolinas to get more of this BBQ immediately.  I can't stop thinking about it... the pulled pork is having normal appearances in my dreams.  Do yourself a favor and go here immediately.

photos.caption: Photo of McKoy's Smokehouse & Saloon - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled wings - fall off the bone tender.

aHSpxy4yzAsRTy1U75kMWA.text: Great food. Had the pot roast. Wife had the half rack of ribs. But portions and was able to somehow finish mine washed down with a good beer. Will definitely be back.

tyXE3g2M59H3cdoxVHYX6Q.text: Yes.  A nice BBQ joint complete with smoky, tasting meat and a great menu.  Our server, Abbie, was simply on her game and her experience shows.  It was nice to see a manager visit with us, too.  We went for the slow-smoked wings, fried green tomatoes (some of the best we've tried), and ceasar salad.  It was all wonderful and we can't wait to return.  We've found a serious competitor to both Max's and Midwood Smokehouse.  Q-City and Sauceman's have been left in the ashes of these BBQ power players, IMO.

photos.caption: Photo of McKoy's Smokehouse & Saloon - Charlotte, NC, United States. Double grilled wings as God intended:  smoky, juicy, and smothered in Calypso sauce.  Mmmmm.

OGd3662q_irMy6j6PtvZ_Q.text: Had to have some Carolina BBQ before heading out of Charlotte and boy was this the right spot to hit!  Started out with the fried squash and it was excellent!   I had the half pecan smoked chicken which had amazing flavor and fell off the bone.  The greens cooked in pork stock took me back home to Grandmas house in Texas... and the Mac n Cheese to die for.  Our waitress Gillian was also super friendly and very attentive .  True Southern comfort food!

photos.caption: Photo of McKoy's Smokehouse & Saloon - Charlotte, NC, United States. Started eating before I remembered to snap my pic!  Half chicken with Mac n Cheese and Collard Greens

wPw07cw0yT7bQ0q5ETqvJw.text: Came here with the Mrs and both offspring. The waitress told us to get the Double Smoked Wings and the "LTD" sampler platter...  Job done! great call by her. Ohh and the Cornbread!  I hate cornbread, but this was fantastic cheesy wonderfulness.  But the Meat is where they loose a star, the Smoked Chicken Leg and the Beef were both pretty dried out.   I will be very happy to come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of McKoy's Smokehouse & Saloon - Charlotte, NC, United States. LTD and Wings.

idJ5vsLjytFkFOiZTBBlpA.text: Stopped in mid afternoon for late lunch. Sat at a high top table in the bar area. Waitress was truly friendly and helpful. My associate and I split the entree Living The Dream, which is a BBQ platter of pulled pork, pot roast, chicken and ribs. Each selection was delicious as was the BBQ sauce. Between the two of us, we could not finish the entire platter of meat because the portion size was beyond huge! The two sides we had, mac & cheese and cole slaw were OK. Overall, great place. Glad we stopped!

cH8U7QGY8mI1Jxw1dIS9fA.text: Ok, the food was petty good, I would say 3 stars, but really elevated the meal for me was my server Sierra.  She went above and beyond to assist me!  Sierra was very attentive and responsive to my requests. I found the BBQ a bit overdone, and the sauces weren't really to my liking, especially the tomato based sauce.  Just over all so so BBQ, but the service is great, and yes, I'd come back.

photos.caption: Photo of McKoy's Smokehouse & Saloon - Charlotte, NC, United States. The LTD meal

fjLCStBI7D_fqCsX4xWuMA.text: Stopped in Charlotte for the night as we were en route to DC. I saw this place on Yelp and also noticed it was near our hotel. I got the Living the Dream and boy were my eyes bigger than my belly. Portion size was huge, hindsight I could've shared this with my Dad. Customer service was great, waitress was very attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of McKoy's Smokehouse & Saloon - Charlotte, NC, United States

0XnoSW3LWrgk46Nisq2ARw.text: I bought my dad to McKoys because I had a great experience with the service and food on my first time trying them with Coworkers.   They have great home style cooking and staff was very friendly including the manager. This time I went I ordered the fried chicken and it was fried a little too hard and sorta tasted burnt. It the chicken to be their special for that day I thought it would be a little better but that wasn't the case.   I addressed this with server and she apologized, and the manager also came out to address my concerns. I appreciated they both addressing this issue, and the offer to replace my meal. I was unable to accept due to my time and needing to head back to work.   My suggestion would be to change the grease as often on days when chicken is the special.

photos.caption: Photo of McKoy's Smokehouse & Saloon - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken, collards and mac!
Photo of McKoy's Smokehouse & Saloon - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken salad and collard greens

U0pBgAMQIWouwO2Um2J-WA.text: Nothing more to say....go eat here. I'd recommend this place 10/10 times if I could. The food is awesome.

PcMXzFuNfVjasGg0ILpgTQ.text: I stopped here because I was told the smoked wings were bomb.com. I told dude (colleague), I had the best smoked wings in the Nation when I was in Kentucky. He said these are good. They were alright. I got a 12-piece smoked BBQ double grilled ($1.50 extra). They over grilled the hell out of those damn wings. I thought it might have been only me but my colleague said the same thing, they were charred AF. The BBQ sauce was burnt on. My colleague stated that they are usually not like that. I ate them anyway because I just got off a flight and was hungry but If I am in the area again, I will give them a second chance. Service was 5 stars Food was 2 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of McKoy's Smokehouse & Saloon - Charlotte, NC, United States. Where is the sauce?

tdhudKi_vwCVGpxlNR_g1g.text: This place is the bessssttttt! Always great service. I'll normally get the Huge ltd platter. It's so good it will last me for dinner and lunch the next day.  I discovered this place on a whim and have been an avid McKoy's customer for over a year now and this place never fails

6jWZMLPAugLAx0eOu6LQkg.text: I've been to McKoy's many times. Mostly for the pork platter and their fantastic Mac'n'Cheese. These are my two staples here. Thanks to the Yelp Wing Fling I was introduced to their... wings. They are smoked to perfection and expect them to be a little bit pink. The chicken is juicy and tender almost fall-of-the bone like.   I heard on the local radio station that McKoy is famed for their Meatloaf, not knowing it was a Monday only special. So on a Monday, I remembered and tried it out. It's juicy with a crushed tomato based sauce that has a little kick to it. I almost wanted to say meatball sauce, but it got more texture to it. Paired it with yummy Mac'n'Cheese of course and fries, to soak up the sauce!  Parking is quite tough, not only is the lot tight, but during lunch or dinner rush, is packed, which is a good sign. It's a bar, saloon type setting, with high tables, booths and bar. Also locally known as a Harley Bar, I do roll up occasionally on a Ducati without getting a stink-eye. They have a lot of TV's and are a game day hot spot. You can also order their wings in advance for your viewing party at home. (HECK YAH!)  Staff is friendly and attentive, orders taken quick and food come out just as quick.

photos.caption: Photo of McKoy's Smokehouse & Saloon - Charlotte, NC, United States. Meatloaf monday!
Photo of McKoy's Smokehouse & Saloon - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bikers know.

YAp_bkjdKaBiOyhdk-kaTw.text: I. Am. Soooooo happy. I wish y'all could understand how much I enjoyed this meal. NC has been a disappointment so far (food wise) and this place single handedly saved the state.  The wings are sooooo good. Like soo soo good. I'm not even a big wings guy. The waitress recommended the carolina apple something. And I also went with the Thai chili and man they knocked my socks off.   Then the corn bread. Paired perfectly with the wings. The drinks ate LITTTY and the Mac and cheese.. well I'll try when I get in.   This place is the Bomb. A lil drive from where I'm staying but totally worth it. Another amazing discovery from yelp!

photos.caption: Photo of McKoy's Smokehouse & Saloon - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half the Drink menu

7fMyxo6Q2Chgfb3zSFk41g.text: This was definitely the best place for dinner in Charlotte! It was super packed since it was AllStar weekend. But besides that the service was still on point!  Parking was easy as well. Ok so here we go... We had the Ribs, Smoked Wings (WOW), Pulled Chicken, Pulled Pork, CORNBREAD a MUSTTTTTTTTTTT (WOW), Mac & Cheese (WOW), Fried Okra, and the Mushrooms side. Everything was DELICIOSOOOOOO! I am drooling for it now, those smoked wings WOW!!! Win Win...  I highly recommend it and will be back there!
